00029 Vector3d  Cross(const Vector3d & vector1 ,const Vector3d & vector2) {
00030 
00031     Vector3d normal = Vector3d();
00032 
00033     // Calculate the cross product with the non communitive equation
00034 
00035 
00036     normal(0) = vector1(1) * vector2(2) - vector1(2) * vector2(1);
00037 
00038     normal(1) = vector1(2) * vector2(0) - vector1(0) * vector2(2);
00039 
00040     normal(2) = vector1(0) * vector2(1) - vector1(1) * vector2(0);
00041 
00042 
00043 
00044     // Return the cross product
00045 
00046     return normal;
00047 
00048 }
00049 
00050 
00051 float Magnitude(const Vector3d & vec) {
00052 
00053     return (float)std::sqrt( vec(0) * vec(0) + vec(1) * vec(1) + vec(2) * vec(2) );
00054 
00055 }
00056 
00057 
00058 Vector3d & Normalize( Vector3d & vector) {
00059 
00060     // Get the magnitude of our normal
00061 
00062     float magnitude = Magnitude(vector);
00063 
00064     vector = vector / magnitude;
00065 
00066 
00067 
00068     return vector;
00069 
00070 }

00073 Camera::Camera() {
00074 
00075     position_ = Vector3d();
00076 
00077     view_ = Vector3d();
00078 
00079     up_vector_   = Vector3d();
00080 
00081 
00082     view_(0) = 0.0;
00083     view_(1) = 1.0;
00084     view_(2) = 0.5;
00085 
00086     up_vector_(1) = 1.0;
00087 
00088 }

00117 void Camera::rotate_view(float angle, const Vector3d & rot_vec) {
00118 
00119     Vector3d new_view;
00120 
00121 
00122 
00123     // Get the view vector (The direction we are facing)
00124 
00125     new_view = view_ - position_;
00126 
00127 
00128 
00129     // Calculate the sine and cosine of the angle once
00130 
00131     float cosTheta = (float)std::cos(angle);
00132 
00133     float sinTheta = (float)std::sin(angle);
00134 
00135 
00136 
00137     // Find the new x position for the new rotated point
00138 
00139     new_view(0)  = (cosTheta + (1 - cosTheta) * rot_vec(0) * rot_vec(0) )* view_(0);
00140 
00141     new_view(0) += ((1 - cosTheta) * rot_vec(0) * rot_vec(1) - rot_vec(2) * sinTheta)   * view_(1);
00142 
00143     new_view(0) += ((1 - cosTheta) * rot_vec(0) * rot_vec(2) + rot_vec(1) * sinTheta)   * view_(2);
00144 
00145 
00146 
00147     // Find the new y position for the new rotated point
00148 
00149     new_view(1)  = ((1 - cosTheta) * rot_vec(0) * rot_vec(1) + rot_vec(2) * sinTheta)   * view_(0);
00150 
00151     new_view(1) += (cosTheta + (1 - cosTheta) * rot_vec(1) * rot_vec(1) )       * view_(1);
00152 
00153     new_view(1) += ((1 - cosTheta) * rot_vec(1) * rot_vec(2) - rot_vec(0) * sinTheta)   * view_(2);
00154 
00155 
00156 
00157     // Find the new z position for the new rotated point
00158 
00159     new_view(2)  = ((1 - cosTheta) * rot_vec(0) * rot_vec(2) - rot_vec(1) * sinTheta)   * view_(0);
00160 
00161     new_view(2) += ((1 - cosTheta) * rot_vec(1) * rot_vec(2) + rot_vec(0) * sinTheta)   * view_(1);
00162 
00163     new_view(2) += (cosTheta + (1 - cosTheta) * rot_vec(2) * rot_vec(2) )       * view_(2);
00164 
00165 
00166 
00167     // Now we just add the newly rotated vector to our position to set
00168 
00169     // our new rotated view of our camera.
00170 
00171     view_ = position_ + new_view;
00172 
00173 }

00226 void Camera::look() const{
00227 
00228     // Give openGL our camera position, then camera view, then camera up vector
00229 
00230     gluLookAt(position_(0), position_(1), position_(0),
00231               view_(0),  view_(1),     view_(2),
00232               up_vector_(0), up_vector_(1), up_vector_(2));
00233 
00234 }
